solution_line_template: Jennifer's home is {first_museum_distance} miles away from the first museum, so the round trip back and forth is {first_museum_distance} miles there + {first_museum_distance} miles back = <<{first_museum_distance}+{first_museum_distance}={first_day_travel}>>{first_day_travel} miles altogether.

On another day Jennifer goes to a museum {second_museum_distance} miles away + {second_museum_distance} miles to return home = <<{second_museum_distance}+{second_museum_distance}={second_day_travel}>>{second_day_travel} miles total.

Combined, Jennifer travels {first_day_travel} miles on the first day + {second_day_travel} miles on the second day = <<{first_day_travel}+{second_day_travel}={total_travel}>>{total_travel} miles Jennifer travels total.
